title: No Skillshot that Can bank off of terrain?
body:
I was thinking of that idea a lot lately and find it surprising it hasn't already been done.

It should gain extra effects when bouncing off terrain to reward the difficulty.

Just imagine the fun and unique interactions with it.

Wall bouncing skillshots are one of those things we've tested on a couple of prototypes, felt had good promise, but haven't found the right fit for. I'm pretty sure we'll do such an ability on a champion we ship at some point though. We've had most success with a 90 degree bounce off terrain approach, keeps the physics/kinetic feeling but also gives consistent enough behavior you can plan around it as both caster and enemy. Versions that attempted to calculate an expected angle off angle of hit to terrain and shape of terrain by contrast result in a lot of failed expectations.
Ideas for {{champion:161}} perhaps?

Vel'Koz already has pretty unique to use abilities with his Q and R. Wouldn't want to put a wall bounce on the same kit as Vel'Koz Q in particular (serves the same need), so while I can see the appeal would want to do so on a different champ as a bread and butter skill.

I'm pretty sure we'll do such an ability on a champion we ship at some point though. We've had most success with a 90 degree bounce off terrain approach, keeps the physics/kinetic feeling but also gives consistent enough behavior you can plan around it as both caster and enemy. Versions that attempted to calculate an expected angle off angle of hit to terrain and shape of terrain by contrast result in a lot of failed expectations.

Instead of doing in-depth mathematics or really simple right angles, wouldn't it be easier to do something in between where it will bounce off the wall at the same angle it contacts it based on where the champion is when it's fired, regardless of how it hits the wall? This would eliminate the issue with wiffs on terrain angles and allow for a higher skill ceiling.

The only "issue" I could see with this would be largely a balancing thing. Doing it this way could effectively double the range of the ability and other parts of the kit would probably have to be changed to compensate for a skill that could effectively be a curving Nidalee spear.

Selfishly, I would love if a champ came out with a nuke-ability that had an interaction like that. (I miss Nid's 2k-damage-spears-of-doom)
I would look forward to a champion that uses this mechanic. Don't let it down please.

I could see a 90 degree wall bank skill shot being very fun to use given the right champion (maybe put it in a yordle's kit?).

The mechanics of such a skill that went through my head was:
- A linear skill shot that stops at the first unit hit (Chamion > Minnion > Monster > Champion spawned unit).
- If the skill shot collides with terrain it resets it's trajectory to 90 degrees away from terrain hit.
- If the skill shot collides with terrain it resets it's travel duration (repeat infinitely) until it collides with a unit, or reaches it's maximum distance from it's last travel duration reset.
- To prevent a situation where a single skill shot is unable collide with a unit or reach it's maximum distance after colliding with terrain, the maximum life span of a single skill shot is 30 seconds.
- The skill shot gives no vision, but you can see it traveling on the minimap.

I feel that it would create the best wall bank fantasy (especially in the jungle) where you can send the skill through the jungle in an attempt to hit someone in there (The billiards 6 wall bank shot to hit a blocked ball into the pocket comes to mind). It adds some scouting potential without being too oppressive since the opposing jungler can still dodge it, also since the ability give zero vision it's up to the player to determine whether their skill stopping suddenly is because it hit a jungle camp or if it hit the jungler, or if it simply timed out.

Maybe I am wrong, but I am looking at this tread as if it is an idea for a new champion. If this is the case, why not also give the champion an ability that places a wall that could be used as an impassable barrier like an Anivia wall or Azir's ult. I would say if it can be placed like Rumble's Equalizer (but obviously not as long) then it can be better utilized in coordination with their ricochet ability.

So I wonder if the walls in league are sufficiently 'smooth' that ricochets would actually behave as expected (i.e. according to the law of reflection for light). It's possible that there's some subtle curves in most of the terrain that might make things less than ideal in practice. Still, it could be a fun idea to play around with.

That said, I am reminded of vel'koz's Q which captures a lot of the same angle manipulating mechanics that this would entail, so there is something at least kind of similar for players to play around with if they like the idea of being able to shoot around stuff by careful aim.

They are. The 'jaggedness' of the terrain is really just visual texture mapping. If it was really as non-uniform as it appears champion models would get stuck on walls much more frequently. Even the existing curves could easily be averaged to give a fairly consistent angle that could be roughly estimated at a glance. And, most likely a dynamic targeting indicator would be available to show the exact path in which the missile would take.

I'm no coder by a longshot but maybe they could have a hidden passive that creates a smooth zone around any terrain within range, that only interacts with the ability.

The only reason I gave an either/or is because it is ultimately up to Riot to balance the ability, and most likely if it is a pass through ability it will have a limit to how many times it could proc on a single target (if it is designed to do so) and the damage per pass would be lower, but can stack up fairly high, again, at a limit. If it is deemed to be a single target and not pass through, then it would be more likely for the damage stacking to be a result on how many times it has bounced before making contact with that target, and the total damage would, again, be capped. Also, your statement about being damaged once per ability is false.
